tweet:
The #GOPTaxScam increased the tax rate for service member survivors' benefits.

We shouldn't ask Gold Star families to pay more while big corporations get huge tax cuts. Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth has a bill to fix this problem for survivors. https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/24/politics/gold-star-families-higher-taxes/index.html …
Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth Statement on the 2019 Medicare and Social Security Trustees Reports: pic.twitter.com/pVOp5tM3z9

Unfortunately, the Trump Administration is making the situation worse.

The #TrumpBudget slashes spending across the federal government on clean energy innovation, climate science and research, and preparedness and resilience in the face of a changing climate. #EarthDay pic.twitter.com/o8xcx6tj5p

Climate change will continue to substantially damage the economy even as the federal government spends billions annually on disaster recovery.

Taking climate action wouldn't just improve our planet- it would improve our nation's fiscal outlook. #EarthDay https://wapo.st/2Ux97s6

Climate change creates more severe weather events, threatens our public health, and jeopardizes our national security. #EarthDay

It also has serious budgetary consequences. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/2AvKp3q  pic.twitter.com/yBK8zpvtH0

The #TrumpBudget slashes investments in health care, education, and other programs that help working families, all to pay for the #GOPTaxScam.

@HouseDemocrats believe the wealthy and big corporations should pay their fair share. https://medium.com/@HouseBudgetDems/the-first-tax-filing-season-under-the-gop-tax-law-shows-the-rich-big-corporations-benefitted-most-4626eb6f38eb …

Not only did 60 of America’s biggest corporations pay $0 in federal income taxes this season - they actually received a net tax rebate of $4B.

Meanwhile, small businesses saw disappointing tax savings, higher prep fees, and mass confusion. #GOPTaxScam
 https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/first-tax-filing-season-under-gop-tax-law-shows-rich-and-big-corporations …

President Trump added $2T to the deficit with the #GOPTaxScam. Now his budget demands huge cuts to health care to pay for massive tax cuts for the wealthy and big corporations. #TaxDay2019 #TaxDay pic.twitter.com/u9eWQWz3rR

It’s #TaxDay2019, and President Trump wants you to be on the hook for his #GOPTaxScam. His budget slashes investments in working families and the middle class, like education and health care, while protecting tax cuts for the wealthy and big corporations. #TaxDay pic.twitter.com/cA4SXwN91Q

Instead of giveaways to the rich like Republicans' #GOPTaxScam, we need fiscally responsible tax policies that put middle‑class families and those working to climb into the middle class first, and make sure the wealthiest Americans and corporations pay their fair share. #TaxDay

As Americans file federal income taxes for the first year under the #GOPTaxScam, working families and Main Street small businesses are once again being reminded of the law’s broken promises. #TaxDay #TaxDay2019
 https://medium.com/@HouseBudgetDems/the-first-tax-filing-season-under-the-gop-tax-law-shows-the-rich-big-corporations-benefitted-most-4626eb6f38eb …

With #TaxDay fast approaching, working Americans have been filing their taxes and paying their fair share.

Meanwhile, thanks to the #GOPTaxScam, more large corporations are getting away with paying $0. https://www.nbcnews.com/business/taxes/twice-many-companies-paying-zero-taxes-under-trump-tax-plan-n993046?cid=sm_npd_nn_tw_mtp …

As the first tax filing season under the #GOPTaxScam draws to a close, more and more Americans - on both sides of the aisle - are seeing first-hand how the law benefits wealthy investors and big corporations far more than working families. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/05/few-americans-think-theyre-getting-a-trump-tax-cut-nbcwsj-poll.html …

More than 100 organizations are joining @NDDUnited in calling on Congress to #RaiseTheCaps and pass the Investing for the People Act. Our two-year budget, protects critical investments that support working- and middle-class families.
 
Read more: http://www.nddunited.org/hr2021

Congress owes the American people a budget that works. The Investing for the People Act doesn't waste time on symbolic gestures - it sets forth realistic, two-year funding levels that make critical investments in our economic and national security. #RaiseTheCaps pic.twitter.com/IFdaH68gOz

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth at @RulesDemocrats: "By passing the Investing for the People Act, we in the House will be doing our jobs, following regular order, and ensuring we can meet the needs and priorities of our families and communities.”

Live now: Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth speaks at @RulesDemocrats on the urgent need to #RaiseTheCaps and pass the Investing for the People Act.

Watch: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sbrckYlyPe8 …

Our two-year budget, the Investing for the People Act, sets funding levels that will provide opportunities for workers and the middle class, today and tomorrow. #RaiseTheCaps pic.twitter.com/2zTL8SzoSm

Watch: Budget Committee Democrats speak out on the urgent need for Congress to pass the Investing for the People Act to #RaiseTheCaps.

Our two-year budget rejects #TrumpBudget's devastating cuts & protects critical investments in programs that enhance Americans' daily lives. pic.twitter.com/SVSvIeYSg9

From K-12 education to veterans’ health, our budgets should support programs that enhance Americans’ daily lives.

That's why it's vital that Congress pass the Investing for the People Act to #RaiseTheCaps and protect these critical investments. More:  https://bit.ly/2CYhdUG  pic.twitter.com/LIw5TWG3VO

Breaking: House Budget Committee passes the Investing for the People Act, a two-year budget that makes much-needed investments in our nation's economic and national security.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth's statement:  https://bit.ly/2HWKinI  pic.twitter.com/7AZtCd2LRv

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: "I have always maintained that budgets are about our values, and with this legislation, we will show the American people that we value their security, their opportunities, and their future." pic.twitter.com/JfV7l12GWG

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: I have always maintained that budgets are about our values, and with the Investing for the People Act, we will show the American people that we value their security, their opportunities, and their future.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: If Congress doesn’t establish new spending caps this year, it will result in devastating cuts to important investments and services that millions of Americans need. #RaiseTheCaps

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: Throughout our history, the US has made strategic investments in our people, our economy, and our security that allowed us to innovate and grow, while promoting broad-based economic opportunity. This bill will build on that legacy.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: If Congress fails to act, we face austerity-level budget caps next year. And we have a President who submitted a budget so irresponsible that it is unusable.

In the face of recklessness, the budget before us achieves stability and responsible governing.

Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth: The Investing for the People Act is a two-year budget to stabilize discretionary funding levels, provide appropriators with required spending toplines, and ensure Congress can meet its obligations to the American people.
The Committee's markup of H.R. 2021, the Investing for the People Act, will begin momentarily: https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1PlJQyOpNVaJE …

If Congress does not act, funding for education, veterans’ health care, affordable housing, transportation, and other vital programs will face extreme cuts.

The Investing for the People Act offers a government that works for the American people. https://www.cbpp.org/research/federal-budget/house-budget-committee-proposal-would-avoid-steep-cuts-and-provide-resources …

Democrats value investments that open the doors of opportunity for Americans - investments like health care, education, and community development.

That's why our two-year budget, the Investing for the People Act, makes these investments possible. #RaiseTheCaps #CutsHurt pic.twitter.com/AANNeyoy7g
Tune in here at 2:00 P.M. to watch the Committee’s markup of H.R. 2021, the Investing for the People Act to #RaiseTheCaps. pic.twitter.com/wR6j9NeOvF

The #TrumpBudget would slash funding for vital programs, from K-12 education to clean air and water. Our budget will #RaiseTheCaps to support programs that enhance Americans’ daily lives.  https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2019/04/02/us/politics/ap-us-congress-budget-battle.html …
#EqualPay benefits families, workers, & the economy. House Democrats passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct, now it's time for the Senate to do the same. #EqualPayDay pic.twitter.com/L5nso5wYKz

.@AppropsDems Chairwoman Nita Lowey understands the vital and urgent need to #RaiseTheCaps and protect both defense and non-defense investments. We're pleased to have her support for the Investing for the People Act as an original cosponsor. pic.twitter.com/CsyqIGsbdv

Today Chairman @RepJohnYarmuth is unveiling a two-year budget that will #RaiseTheCaps and save critical programs from the cruel, extreme cuts proposed in the #TrumpBudget. Learn more: https://bit.ly/2FItCwK

Investments in America unleash opportunities for working families and the middle class. But austerity-level spending caps put these investments at risk.

The Investing for the People Act will #RaiseTheCaps to enable critical investments in our future. https://budget.house.gov/publications/report/devastating-consequences-2020-and-2021-budget-caps …

Our two-year budget, the Investing for the People Act, sets funding levels that will provide opportunities for workers and the middle class, today and tomorrow. #RaiseTheCaps

Learn more:  https://bit.ly/2VbIxWI  pic.twitter.com/r6EciTcRuR
The #TrumpBudget's cruel cuts are yet another move in the GOP's years-long effort to sabotage our health care system. Democrats are fighting #ForThePeople to lower health care costs and drug prices.

Fact: the nonpartisan CBO found the GOP's #TrumpCare plan would cause millions to lose coverage. And just like that plan, the proposals in the #TrumpBudget would leave people with pre-existing conditions without access to care. https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/4/1/18290422/trump-mulvaney-health-plan-graham-cassidy …
